channel.title: Install Arch Linux (or any distro) without any external media!
channel.description:
Right, so one of my computer does not have a cd or dvd drive which naturally led me to find this awesome guideline on how to install it without any external media!
http://it.dennyhalim.com/2008/03/install-linux-from-windows-without.html
I found it really helpful, and hopefully you will too.
Enjoy :)

@runescape3dude wrote:

When I tried to load a Windows ISO from this, I didn’t succeed… Must have been because I had the GRUB/ISO on the Vista partition (XP is out of space)

Read full topic
item.source: Install Arch Linux (or any distro) without any external media!

item.title: Install Arch Linux (or any distro) without any external media!
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:264007”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=348617.msg2684633#msg2684633 date=1235596136]

It works with debian too:
http://it.dennyhalim.com/2008/08/boot-install-debian-ubuntu-from-ntfs.html

Seems like it should work with any distro though. Good find!

Except if you needed to resize your windows partition you would pretty much be screwed wouldn’t you? Unless you could get the installer to load completely into RAM and unmount the disk.

Resizing partitions isn’t hard or dangerous nowadays. Utilities such as Partition Magic 8.0 by PowerQuest works just fine (and can be used in DOS from a live CD).
[/quote]

I didn’t say it was hard or dangerous, just that it can’t be done when the partition is mounted, and that you couldn’t unmount it if you were using files from it.

And as far as partition editing goes, I haven’t found a tool yet that beats a gparted livecd. ;)[/quote]

Sorry, I misunderstood the comment about being screwed.

Read full topic

item.title: Install Arch Linux (or any distro) without any external media!
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:10, topic:264007”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=348617.msg2682449#msg2682449 date=1235450679]
I managed to load the ARCHLINUX_IDE.img file without any problems (beside the fact i should have picked PATA)
[/quote]

That is PATA :P[/quote]nop, there’s ARCHLINUX_IDE and ARCHLINUX_PATA

Read full topic
item.source: Install Arch Linux (or any distro) without any external media!

item.title: Install Arch Linux (or any distro) without any external media!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman

@Mopman wrote:

Speljohan:

I managed to load the ARCHLINUX_IDE.img file without any problems (beside the fact i should have picked PATA)

That is PATA

Read full topic
item.source: Install Arch Linux (or any distro) without any external media!

item.title: Install Arch Linux (or any distro) without any external media!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:8, topic:264007”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=348617.msg2684333#msg2684333 date=1235583375]
It works with debian too:

it.dennyhalim.com

boot & install debian / ubuntu from ntfs

so, when other distros fail me, i always return to debian. it's a little bit harder to setup, but it (almost) always works on any hardware ...

Seems like it should work with any distro though. Good find!

Except if you needed to resize your windows partition you would pretty much be screwed wouldn’t you? Unless you could get the installer to load completely into RAM and unmount the disk.
[/quote]

Resizing partitions isn’t hard or dangerous nowadays. Utilities such as Partition Magic 8.0 by PowerQuest works just fine (and can be used in DOS from a live CD).[/quote]

I didn’t say it was hard or dangerous, just that it can’t be done when the partition is mounted, and that you couldn’t unmount it if you were using files from it.

And as far as partition editing goes, I haven’t found a tool yet that beats a gparted livecd.

Read full topic
item.source: Install Arch Linux (or any distro) without any external media!

item.title: Install Arch Linux (or any distro) without any external media!
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:264007”]It works with debian too:

it.dennyhalim.com

boot & install debian / ubuntu from ntfs

so, when other distros fail me, i always return to debian. it's a little bit harder to setup, but it (almost) always works on any hardware ...

Seems like it should work with any distro though. Good find!

Except if you needed to resize your windows partition you would pretty much be screwed wouldn’t you? Unless you could get the installer to load completely into RAM and unmount the disk.[/quote]

Resizing partitions isn’t hard or dangerous nowadays. Utilities such as Partition Magic 8.0 by PowerQuest works just fine (and can be used in DOS from a live CD).

Read full topic

Right, so one of my computer does not have a cd or dvd drive which naturally led me to find this awesome guideline on how to install it without any external media!

it.dennyhalim.com

install linux from windows without cdrom

nowadays, linux is easy to install. most distro have livecd that you can just boot into linux without installing it first. but, i have an ...
